data.title: 1903:President Supports Lewis : IN OUR PAGES:100, 75 AND 50 YEARS AGO - The New York Times
data.meta_description: WASHINGTON: The President to-day [Jan. 12] contributed an interesting chapter to the race problem by announcing his determination to have the district attorney of Boston appoint Mr. William H. Lewis, a colored attorney, as assistant United States attorney
data.text: WASHINGTON: The President to-day [Jan. 12] contributed an interesting chapter to the race problem by announcing his determination to have the district attorney of Boston appoint Mr. William H. Lewis, a colored attorney, as assistant United States attorney at Boston. Heretofore all appointments of colored men have been confined to the Southern States, where they form a large proportion of the population. These have usually had their strongest endorsement in Boston and the New England States.
